column4: i keep trying to use 'ssh -R 9999:localhost:22 user@remotehost' to tunnel an ssh connection for my locked up work machine.  this works, but I must first ssh to remotehost, then establish a connection to localhost on port 9999 to connect to my locked up work machine.

is there a way to make this bind to a specific up or interface on the remotehost side? so i can skip logging into the remote host, and ssh directly to remotehost:9999 ?  i have tried the typical remotehost:9999:localhost:22... howver it fails to bind on remotehost's wan ip.
remotehost has a dedicated ip, and i can bind to ports.
i don't think you're supposed to be doing that..
dunno.. you should check with your company policy?
btw u would use another option
i need a static mysql connection.
there's actually a number of ways you can automate this-- probably 1 you'd be familar with is -c
and for some reason althou it works on the remotehost, mysql client automatically assumes localhost is on the default mysql port.
if you're using putty, u can setup what command to run right away after login
